google_compute_instance.description: Manages a VM instance resource within GCE.

boot_disk.description: The boot disk for the instance.

name.description: A unique name for the resource, required by GCE.

zone.description: The zone that the machine should be created in.

network_interface.description: Networks to attach to the instance. This can

allow_stopping_for_update.description: If true, allows Terraform to stop the instance to update its properties.

attached_disk.description: Additional disks to attach to the instance. Can be repeated multiple times for multiple disks. Structure is documented below.

can_ip_forward.description: Whether to allow sending and receiving of

description.description: A brief description of this resource.

desired_status.description: Desired status of the instance. Either

deletion_protection.description: Enable deletion protection on this instance. Defaults to false.

hostname.description: A custom hostname for the instance. Must be a fully qualified DNS name and RFC-1035-valid.

guest_accelerator.description: List of the type and count of accelerator cards attached to the instance. Structure documented below.

labels.description: A map of key/value label pairs to assign to the instance.

metadata.description: Metadata key/value pairs to make available from

min_cpu_platform.description: Specifies a minimum CPU platform for the VM instance. Applicable values are the friendly names of CPU platforms, such as

project.description: The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it

scheduling.description: The scheduling strategy to use. More details about

scratch_disk.description: Scratch disks to attach to the instance. This can be

service_account.description: Service account to attach to the instance.

tags.description: A list of tags to attach to the instance.

resource_policies.description: -- A list of short names or self_links of resource policies to attach to the instance. Modifying this list will cause the instance to recreate. Currently a max of 1 resource policy is supported.

auto_delete.description: Whether the disk will be auto-deleted when the instance

device_name.description: Name with which the attached disk will be accessible

kms_key_self_link.description: The self_link of the encryption key that is

initialize_params.description: Parameters for a new disk that will be created

source.description: The name or self_link of the disk to attach to this instance.

size.description: The size of the image in gigabytes. If not specified, it

type.description: - The accelerator type resource to expose to this instance. E.g. `nvidia-tesla-k80`.

image.description: The image from which to initialize this disk. This can be

interface.description: The disk interface to use for attaching this disk; either SCSI or NVME.

network.description: The name or self_link of the network to attach this interface to.

network_ip.description: The private IP address to assign to the instance. If

access_config.description: Access configurations, i.e. IPs via which this

nat_ip.description: The IP address that will be 1:1 mapped to the instance's

public_ptr_domain_name.description: The DNS domain name for the public PTR record.

network_tier.description: The [networking tier][network-tier] used for configuring this instance.

subnetwork_range_name.description: The subnetwork secondary range name specifying

email.description: The service account e-mail address. If not given, the

scopes.description: A list of service scopes. Both OAuth2 URLs and gcloud

preemptible.description: Specifies if the instance is preemptible.

automatic_restart.description: Specifies if the instance should be

count.description: - The number of the guest accelerator cards exposed to this instance.

key.description: - The key for the node affinity label.

operator.description: - The operator. Can be `IN` for node-affinities

value.description: - The values for the node affinity label.

enable_secure_boot.description: -- Verify the digital signature of all boot components, and halt the boot process if signature verification fails. Defaults to false.

enable_vtpm.description: -- Use a virtualized trusted platform module, which is a specialized computer chip you can use to encrypt objects like keys and certificates. Defaults to true.

enable_integrity_monitoring.description: -- Compare the most recent boot measurements to the integrity policy baseline and return a pair of pass/fail results depending on whether they match or not. Defaults to true.

instance_id.description: The server-assigned unique identifier of this instance.

metadata_fingerprint.description: The unique fingerprint of the metadata.

self_link.description: The URI of the created resource.

tags_fingerprint.description: The unique fingerprint of the tags.

label_fingerprint.description: The unique fingerprint of the labels.

cpu_platform.description: The CPU platform used by this instance.

network_interface.0.network_ip.description: The internal ip address of the instance, either manually or dynamically assigned.

network_interface.0.access_config.0.nat_.description: If the instance has an access config, either the given external ip (in the `nat_ip` field) or the ephemeral (generated) ip (if you didn't provide one).
